Method Detail

getInstance

public static Appboy getInstance(android.app.Activity activity)

openSession

public void openSession()
Description copied from interface: IAppboy
Opens a new session or resumes the previous session (if openSession is called within 10 seconds of closeSession). This must be called in the Activity's onStart method.

Specified by:
openSession in interface IAppboy
See Also:
IAppboy.openSession()

closeSession

public void closeSession()
Description copied from interface: IAppboy
Closes the current session. The session may be reopened if a call is made to IAppboy.openSession() within 10 seconds. This must be called in the Activity's onStop method.

Specified by:
closeSession in interface IAppboy
See Also:
IAppboy.closeSession()

submitFeedback

public boolean submitFeedback(java.lang.String replyToEmail,
                              java.lang.String message,
                              boolean isReportingABug)
Description copied from interface: IAppboy
Submits a piece of feedback to the Appboy feedback center so that it can be handled in the Appboy dashboard. The request to submit feedback is made immediately, however, this method does not block and will return as soon as the feedback request is placed on the network queue. Feedback submissions will also flush the session/events queue when the network request is actually made.

Specified by:
submitFeedback in interface IAppboy
Parameters:
replyToEmail - The email address to send feedback replies to.
message - The message input by the user. Must be non-null and non-empty.
isReportingABug - Flag indicating whether or not the feedback describes a bug, or is merely a suggestion/question.
Returns:
a boolean indicating whether or not the feedback item was successfully queued for delivery.
See Also:
IAppboy.submitFeedback(String, String, boolean)

logCustomEvent

public boolean logCustomEvent(java.lang.String eventName)
Description copied from interface: IAppboy
Reports a custom named event.

Specified by:
logCustomEvent in interface IAppboy
Parameters:
eventName - The String identifier for the event to track. Best practice is to track generic events useful for segmenting, instead of specific user actions (i.e. track watched_sports_video instead of watched_video_adrian_peterson_td_mnf).
Returns:
a boolean indicating whether or not the event was successfully attached to the session (to be flushed later).
See Also:
IAppboy.logCustomEvent(String)

logPurchase

public boolean logPurchase(java.lang.String productId,
                           int priceInCents)
Description copied from interface: IAppboy
Reports that the current user made an in app purchase. Useful for tracking and segmenting users more likely to make purchases.

Specified by:
logPurchase in interface IAppboy
Parameters:
productId - The String identifier for the product purchased. Usually the Google Play SKU.
priceInCents - The price paid. All calls to logPurchase should be normalized to a single currency for consistency in filtering across a user base.
Returns:
a boolean indicating whether or not the event was successfully attached to the session (to be flushed later).
See Also:
IAppboy.logPurchase(String, int)

logShare

public boolean logShare(SocialNetwork network)
Description copied from interface: IAppboy
Reports that the current user shared activity to a social network. Useful for tracking and segmenting social media influencers.

Specified by:
logShare in interface IAppboy
Parameters:
network - The network which the share was made on. For shares to multiple networks, call this method multiple times.
Returns:
a boolean indicating whether or not the event was successfully attached to the session (to be flushed later).
See Also:
IAppboy.logShare(com.appboy.enums.SocialNetwork)

refreshAll

public void refreshAll()
Description copied from interface: IAppboy
Requests an immediate refresh of the news feed, slideup and server-side configuration from the Appboy server. All refresh requests also flush the session/events queue when the network request is actually made. Results of refresh calls are reported asynchronously via events. Events can be subscribed to with other methods in this class.

Specified by:
refreshAll in interface IAppboy
See Also:
IAppboy.refreshAll()

refreshSlideup

public void refreshSlideup()
Description copied from interface: IAppboy
Requests an immediate refresh of only the slideup. Use this if you want to check for new slideup messages, but don't want to incur the overhead of pulling down an entire new message feed. All refresh requests also flush the session/events queue when the network request is actually made. Results of refresh calls are reported asynchronously via events. Events can be subscribed to with other methods in this class.

Specified by:
refreshSlideup in interface IAppboy
See Also:
IAppboy.refreshSlideup()

flushImmediately

public void flushImmediately()
Description copied from interface: IAppboy
Requests an immediate flush of the session/events queue. Appboy will periodically report new sessions and events back to the server, however, if you have reason to immediately push new events up, you can do so with flushImmediately. Returns as soon as the flush is requested, doesn't block.

Specified by:
flushImmediately in interface IAppboy
See Also:
IAppboy.flushImmediately()

subscribeToNewSlideups

public void subscribeToNewSlideups(IEventSubscriber<SlideupEvent> subscriber,
                                   android.app.Activity activity)
Description copied from interface: IAppboy
Subscribes to a news Slideup event. The subscriber callback will be called when the a new slideup is sent. The subscriber will be called with a SlideupEvent. Subscriptions are associated with the activity and must be cleared by calling IAppboy.removeActivitySubscriptions(android.app.Activity)

Specified by:
subscribeToNewSlideups in interface IAppboy
Parameters:
subscriber - A callback that should be executed when the news feed is updated.
activity - The active activity.
See Also:
IAppboy.subscribeToNewSlideups(com.appboy.events.IEventSubscriber, android.app.Activity)

subscribeToFeedUpdates

public void subscribeToFeedUpdates(IEventSubscriber<FeedUpdatedEvent> subscriber,
                                   android.app.Activity activity)
Description copied from interface: IAppboy
Subscribes to a news feed event. The subscriber callback will be called when the news feed is updated. The subscriber will be called with a FeedUpdatedEvent. Subscriptions are associated with the activity and must be cleared by calling IAppboy.removeActivitySubscriptions(android.app.Activity)

Specified by:
subscribeToFeedUpdates in interface IAppboy
Parameters:
subscriber - A callback that should be executed when the news feed is updated.
activity - The active activity.
See Also:
IAppboy.subscribeToFeedUpdates(com.appboy.events.IEventSubscriber, android.app.Activity)

removeActivitySubscriptions

public void removeActivitySubscriptions(android.app.Activity activity)
Description copied from interface: IAppboy
Removes all subscribers associated with the activity. Best practice is to put this in Activity.onStop()

Specified by:
removeActivitySubscriptions in interface IAppboy
Parameters:
activity - The activity to which the subscribers are registered.
See Also:
IAppboy.removeActivitySubscriptions(android.app.Activity)
